title.narrative: REIc Solar and Battery Storage Mini-Grids, through Simpliphi Power Inc.

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study for Renewable Energy Innovators Cameroon, a privately-owned company in Cameroon, to develop up to 134 solar PV and battery mini-grids for a total of 3.8 megawatts of electricity in remote locations throughout five of Cameroons ten regions (Project). The Project will be scaled to deploy a total of 760 mini-grids in the next ten years that will address a significant demand for electricity in rural Cameroon.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

The Project will be scaled to deploy a total of 760 mini-grids in the next ten years that will address a significant demand for electricity in rural Cameroon.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Minee Gas-to-Market System, through Government of Cameroon

description.narrative: This $615,000 grant to Cameroon's Ministry of Energy and Water Resources (MINEE) supported a feasibility study to analyze and define requirements and lay out system components at a high level for a gas-to-market system. The study also provided order of magnitude budgets, timetables, and other requirements including technical portions for Requests for Proposals for MINEE's use as they advance the project towards implementation.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - POWER SECTOR, through Government of Cameroon

description.narrative: This feasibility study assesses the viability of a 75 MW hydro-electric power plant at Warak, on the Bini River in northern Cameroon, including the construction of the necessary transmission lines and transformer stations to bring the electricity from Warak to new locations in northern Cameroon, and to export surplus production to Chad and, potentially, Nigeria. The 75 MW plant would alleviate regional power shortages in up to three countries and provide Cameroon with an additional source of revenue.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - MINEE PETROLEUM PRODUCTS PIPELINE, through Government of Cameroon

description.narrative: This $615,000 grant to Cameroon's Ministry of Energy and Water Resources (MINEE) supports a feasibility study (FS) to analyze and define requirements for a petroleum products pipeline. The study also provides order of magnitude budgets, timetables and other requirements including RFP's for MINEE's use as MINEE advances the project towards implementation.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Water Supply Feasibility Study, through Environmental Chemical Corporation

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Water supply and sanitation - large systems
Water supply and sanitation - large systems
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

title.narrative: Water Supply, through Environmental Chemical Corporation

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to the Cameroon Water Utilities Corporation ("Camwater") partially funds a feasibility study to assess the viability of improved water supply at 11 municipalities across Cameroon. The feasibility study will evaluate the water facilities and assess approaches on how to rehabilitate or expand Camwater's existing water supply infrastructure, which could lead to the implementation of treatment and distribution facilities at the 11 municipalities across Cameroon. The feasibility study is performed on a sole source basis by the U.S. firm, Environmental Chemical Corporation.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles
